fields.description:
Can't login with user/admin, even if the user is authenticated properly,
_from /var/log/messages_
{noformat}
Jul 12 04:39:41 g-22-07 authenticated user: superman1/admin
{noformat}

After a while it shows the following error in a dialog box, ({{image1}} attached)
_An unexpected connection error occurred. Please try again later. If you continue experiencing problems, please contact your cloud administrator_
fields.summary: cannot login to user console with account admin or user

comments.body: This is a duplicate of EUCA-6835. But in this case none of the user could login.
Hi Shaon, I was testing for 3.3.0 with FF 20 and 21, and did not see this error.

Hi Alice,

User console also takes longer time to load than it used to. I have tried on multiple browsers but got the same result on Chrome (28.0.1500.71) and Safari (Version 6.0.5 (8536.30.1). On FF 22.0 I was getting "Unresponsive script" warning and the page didn't load.

Let me know if you have any question about it.
When I was trying to log in to [~shaon]'s setup, I saw with firebug that the browser could not find the  help files described in EUCA-6909 as well.

I'm going to update boto and try again;
>>> print boto.__version__
2.5.2


We require boto 2.9.6 and need QA to switch over!
Specifically, this version: http://kojipkgs.fedoraproject.org//packages/python-boto/2.9.6/2.el6/noarch/python-boto-2.9.6-2.el6.noarch.rpm

Here is a source tarball for developers: http://team-ui.s3.amazonaws.com/boto-2.9.6-2.tgz

Hi David,

I am seeing the same issue with boto {{2.5.2/2.9.6/2.9.7}}.
{noformat}
[root@a-32 ~]# python
Python 2.6.6 (r266:84292, Jul 10 2013, 22:48:45)
[GCC 4.4.7 20120313 (Red Hat 4.4.7-3)] on linux2
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
>>> import boto
>>> boto.__version__
'2.9.6'
>>>
{noformat}

I am also seeing the similar error of EUCA-6100,
{noformat}
Jul 15 03:02:17 a-32 Exception in callback <tornado.stack_context._StackContextWrapper object at 0x16ec628>#012Traceback (most recent call last):#012  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/tornado/ioloop.py", line 398, in _run_callback#012    callback()#012  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/eucaconsole/api.py", line 133, in callback#012    self.finish()#012  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/tornado/web.py", line 668, in finish#012    self.request.finish()#012  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/tornado/httpserver.py", line 421, in finish#012    self.connection.finish()#012  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/tornado/httpserver.py", line 185, in finish#012    self._finish_request()#012  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/tornado/httpserver.py", line 221, in _finish_request#012    self.stream.read_until(b("\r\n\r\n"), self._header_callback)#012  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/tornado/iostream.py", line 159, in read_until#012    self._check_closed()#012  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/tornado/iostream.py", line 534, in _check_closed#012    raise IOError("Stream is closed")#012IOError: Stream is closed
{noformat}

But in this case, I have only 6 images,
{noformat}
[root@a-32 ~]# euca-describe-images
IMAGE	eki-330B3D25	tmpxlnilrjtq7/vmlinuz-3.2.0-23-virtual.manifest.xml	742971281565	available	private	i386	kernel				instance-store
IMAGE	eki-F1C63705	loadbalancer_v1/vmlinuz-2.6.32-358.6.2.el6.x86_64.manifest.xml	742971281565	available	private	x86_64	kernel				instance-store
IMAGE	emi-4F1A385F	tmpflvqczbcoh/precise-server-cloudimg-amd64-ext3.img.manifest.xml	742971281565	available	public	i386	machine	eki-330B3D25	eri-13F53BA6		instance-store
IMAGE	emi-8DB035B8	loadbalancer_v1/eucalyptus-load-balancer-image-1.0.0-92.img.manifest.xml	742971281565	available	private	x86_64	machine	eki-F1C63705	eri-D61B36CC		instance-store
IMAGE	eri-13F53BA6	tmpnznqzw3hku/initrd.img-3.2.0-23-virtual.manifest.xml	742971281565	available	private	i386	ramdisk				instance-store
IMAGE	eri-D61B36CC	loadbalancer_v1/initramfs-2.6.32-358.6.2.el6.x86_64.img.manifest.xml	742971281565	available	private	x86_64	ramdisk				instance-store
[root@a-32 ~]# euca-describe-images | wc -l
6
{noformat}
Can I get on the system to try this out? I'd like to run some tests to help debug this.

I am seeing the same issue. Initially using eucalyptus/admin I did not. Then I created a new account. As the admin of the new account when logging in to the UI it times out and I got the same dialog as image1.png.

Installed Packages
Name        : eucalyptus
Arch        : x86_64
Version     : 3.3.1
Release     : 0.0.1134.20130716giteb411dda.el6

I just did a QA source install and it's up and running here: https://10.111.5.62:8888/

I've created  users and logged in just fine. I used account admin and a sub-user (with full permissions by policy).
I do have the new boto version on this cloud (I checked)

If there's a cloud that shows this, I'll have a look.
[~dkavanagh] what source branch did you use? From a QA perspective we need this working in packages so we can verify issues for release.
I realized my build-n-conf setup was using a dev branch from sjones, so I set it to use maint/3.3/testing and will try again. Sorry!

I've looked at another system and now I think I know what it is. EUCA-6946 was written for this problem. My latest system should have this fix since it was pushed to maint/3.3/testing yesterday.
See, ELB isn't configured on the test machine, so the ELB endpoint won't respond properly to a DescribeLoadBalancers. I may need to do more testing based on Steve's fix.
The endless redirect loop that boto gets into will cause the user session to terminate. We think that the CLC is not communicating.
I can confirm the workaround works. I configured ELB and logins are successful for all users.
Yep, it worked for me as well.

As of the latest testing branch build (Release     : 0.0.1150.20130723git31324369.el6) the work around no longer works for me.  I have enabled load balancing support and the user has a policy for full privileges but cannot log into the User Console with the same error message.  The cloud admin can log in just not other users.

I am having the same issue as well, also getting the following in {{/ver/log/messages}},

{noformat}
Jul 24 05:02:21 c-20 Exception in callback <tornado.stack_context._StackContextWrapper object at 0x26637e0>#012Traceback (most recent call last):#012  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/tornado/ioloop.py", line 398, in _run_callback#012    callback()#012  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/eucaconsole/api.py", line 133, in callback#012    self.finish()#012  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/tornado/web.py", line 668, in finish#012    self.request.finish()#012  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/tornado/httpserver.py", line 421, in finish#012    self.connection.finish()#012  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/tornado/httpserver.py", line 185, in finish#012    self._finish_request()#012  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/tornado/httpserver.py", line 221, in _finish_request#012    self.stream.read_until(b("\r\n\r\n"), self._header_callback)#012  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/tornado/iostream.py", line 159, in read_until#012    self._check_closed()#012  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/tornado/iostream.py", line 534, in _check_closed#012    raise IOError("Stream is closed")#012IOError: Stream is closed
{noformat}

Boto version,
{noformat}
Installed Packages
Name        : python-boto
Arch        : noarch
Version     : 2.9.6
Release     : 2.el6
Size        : 6.4 M
{noformat}

Eucalyptus version,
{noformat}
Installed Packages
Name        : eucalyptus
Arch        : x86_64
Version     : 3.3.1
Release     : 0.0.1148.20130719gitd43ce57e.el6
Size        : 2.4 M
Repo        : installed
{noformat}
Attaching screenshot with firebug response. {{ListMetrics}} and {{DescribeAlarms}} shows {{Aborted}} in the response.

I've just tested this with a fresh cloud installed from nightly packages. I'm running the UI on my laptop with boto 2.9.6-2

What I see is that the ListMetrics and DescribeAlarms calls succeed in about 1/2 second. The DescribeLoadBalancers call returns a 503 and causes no ill effect in the browser.

I'll try running the UI on the CLC machine next.
Sorry, false alarm this time. I added policy for the user and restarted eucalyptus-console, then could login successfully.
To get back to Tony's complaint, I just logged in as a user with full privs and it worked like the admin. Please make sure the user has a policy to access ec2 and the triangle services.
So, is this an expected behavior that to access eucalyptus-console user must have appropriate policy for autoscaling/cloud watch? If not, do we already have a bug on this?
Thanks. In that case, perhaps, we should have it in release note.
Is this type of thing best in user console guide and/or release notes??

At this point, it can be considered as a limitation of user console as we already have a workaround and we are targeting a future release to fix this, I believe RN is the right place for this kind. In AWS, it simply shows that the user do not have enough permission to view some resources. e.g "You are not authorized to describe Running Instances"
[~shaon], [~smarvin], how do we get this assigned to someone on the docs team to get it into the RN?

[~jloza], in order to get into the RNs, it needs to be tagged or noted as a Known Issue. I don't recall how Aaron set that up, however. [~lbiasi] or [~neil], do you know how to set up a ticket as a Known Issue?

The issue that needs to be documented as a known issue should have a DOC issue created and linked to it. That DOC issue should have the component set to "Known Issue" 
[~neil] Is that your understanding as well?
Added DOC ticket (DOC-963) as know issue and linked this bug.
Is this something I should close since we're documenting?
[~dkavanagh] no way Jose. This should be fixed. It should not be required to create special "extrodinary" policies just so a user can login. The documentation is just a workaround the problem.
Could you give me more details? If this is related to IAM permissions, could you supply the policy you used? is this with the current nightly builds, or a released version?

This is on the released 3.3.1. The problem is fixed by installing the proper IAM policies allowing cloudwatch:Describe*. My point was just that you might want to check the mechanism used for error logging in console (the end user GUI web service, that is) so that it would not wall(1) messages to logged in sysadmin's terminal, unless there really is an emergency.

Thanks for the info. I found that since the console uses syslog, if it does send some messages to the admin's ssh session which I also don't like. I wasn't sure if it related to having been started by that user (vs at startup) or from having the syslogd port being overrun by messages. We'd like to make logging more flexible.
With regards to the policy. I know I tested with an EC2 only policy, so it should have been OK to not have cloud watch permissions.

From Deependra:

 I also confirm the following
With these versions of software:
eucalyptus - testing - commit ID 69c482dbf548172dbfb32d636fd24088f61d6f3c - 3.4.0
eucalyptus-console - testing commit ID e33dc6b41279c7e6609a5fae1eb62080087f730d - 3.4.0
And this configuration:
Load balancer - not configured - service NOTREADY
EIAM - No policy
I can login as a normal user in non-eucalyptus account via the user console.
Cheers,
Deependra
